trans-unit.source: Specifies and retrieves metadata information from parameters and columns of <xref href="Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlDataRecord"></xref> objects.
This class cannot be inherited.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData"></xref> class with the specified column name and type.

Only the following are allowed to be passed to the constructor as `dbType`: `Bit`, `BigInt`, `DateTime`, `Decimal`, `Float`, `Int`, `Money`, `Numeric`, `SmallDateTime`, `SmallInt`, `SmallMoney`, `TimeStamp`, `TinyInt`, `UniqueIdentifier`, `Xml`.

The following are the default values assigned to `dbType`, depending on the `SqlDbType` (the <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionDatabase%2A>, <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionName%2A>, <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionOwningSchema%2A>, and <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.Type%2A> properties are set to `null`):
SqlDbType
Maximum length
Precision
Scale
Locale
Compare options
None
None
None
None
None
None
None
None
None
None
None
None
None
None
Max (-1)
IgnoreCase, IgnoreKanaType, IgnoreWidth
The name of the column.
The SQL Server type of the parameter or column.
The Name is `null`.
A `SqlDbType` that is not allowed was passed to the constructor as dbType.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData"></xref> class with the specified column name, type, maximum length, precision, scale, locale ID, compare options, and user-defined type (UDT).

This form of the constructor supports table-valued parameters by allowing you to specify if the column is unique in the table-valued parameter, the sort order for the column, and the ordinal of the sort column.
For more information, see [Table-Valued Parameters](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/table-valued-parameters.md).
The name of the column.
The SQL Server type of the parameter or column.
The maximum length of the specified type.
The precision of the parameter or column.
The scale of the parameter or column.
The locale ID of the parameter or column.
The comparison rules of the parameter or column.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> instance that points to the UDT.
Specifes whether this column should use the default server value.
Specifies if the column in the table-valued parameter is unique.
Specifies the sort order for a column.
Specifies the ordinal of the sort column.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData"></xref> class with the specified column name, database name, owning schema, object name, and default server.

This form of the constructor supports table-valued parameters by allowing you to specify if the column is unique in the table-valued parameter, the sort order for the column, and the ordinal of the sort column.
For more information, see [Table-Valued Parameters](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/table-valued-parameters.md).
The name of the column.
The SQL Server type of the parameter or column.
The database name of the XML schema collection of a typed XML instance.
The relational schema name of the XML schema collection of a typed XML instance.
The name of the XML schema collection of a typed XML instance.
Specifes whether this column should use the default server value.
Specifies if the column in the table-valued parameter is unique.
Specifies the sort order for a column.
Specifies the ordinal of the sort column.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData"></xref> class with the specified column name, type, maximum length, locale, compare options, and server default.

This form of the constructor supports table-valued parameters by allowing you to specify if the column is unique in the table-valued parameter, the sort order for the column, and the ordinal of the sort column.
For more information, see [Table-Valued Parameters](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/table-valued-parameters.md).
The name of the column.

The maximum length of the specified type.

Specifies the sort order for a column.
Specifies the ordinal of the sort column.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData"></xref> class with the specified column name, type, user-defined type, SQL Server type, and server default.

This form of the constructor supports table-valued parameters by allowing you to specify if the column is unique in the table-valued parameter, the sort order for the column, and the ordinal of the sort column.
For more information, see [Table-Valued Parameters](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/table-valued-parameters.md).

Specifes whether this column should use the default server value.
Specifies if the column in the table-valued parameter is unique.
Specifies the sort order for a column.
Specifies the ordinal of the sort column.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData"></xref> class with the specified column name, type, precision, scale, and server default.

This form of the constructor supports table-valued parameters by allowing you to specify if the column is unique in the table-valued parameter, the sort order for the column, and the ordinal of the sort column.
For more information, see [Table-Valued Parameters](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/table-valued-parameters.md).

For more information, see [Table-Valued Parameters](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/table-valued-parameters.md).

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData"></xref> class with the specified column name, type, maximum length, precision, scale, locale ID, compare options, and user-defined type (UDT).

Only the following are allowed to be passed to the constructor as `dbType`: `BigInt`, `Bit`, `BitInt`, `DateTime`, `Decimal`, `Float`, `Image`, `Int`, `Money`, `Ntext`, `Numeric`, `Real`, `SmallDateTime`, `SmallInt`, `SmallMoney`, `Text`, `TimeStamp`, `TinyInt`, `UniqueIdentifier`, `Variant`, `Xml`.

The following are the default values assigned to `dbType`, depending on the `SqlDbType` (the <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionDatabase%2A>, <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionName%2A>, <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionOwningSchema%2A>, and <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.Type%2A> properties are set to `null`):
SqlDbType
Maximum length
Precision
Scale
Locale
Compare options
None
None
None
None
None
Max (-1)
None
None
None
Max (-1)

None
\<number of columns>
None

None
None
Max (-1)
\<thread>
IgnoreCase, IgnoreKanaType, IgnoreWidth
None
None
None
\<Max length of the type> or -1
None
None
Max (-1)
IgnoreCase, IgnoreKanaType, IgnoreWidth
The name of the column.
The SQL Server type of the parameter or column.
The maximum length of the specified type.
The precision of the parameter or column.
The scale of the parameter or column.
The locale ID of the parameter or column.
The comparison rules of the parameter or column.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> instance that points to the UDT.
The Name is `null`.
A `SqlDbType` that is not allowed was passed to the constructor as dbType, or userDefinedType points to a type that does not have declared.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData"></xref> class with the specified column name, type, database name, owning schema, and object name.
Only the following `SqlDbType` is allowed to be passed to the constructor as `dbType`: `Xml`.
The following are the default values assigned to `dbType`, depending on the `SqlDbType`:
SqlDbType
Maximum length
Precision
Scale
Locale
Compare options
Max (-1)
IgnoreCase, IgnoreKanaType, IgnoreWidth
The name of the column.
The SQL Server type of the parameter or column.
The database name of the XML schema collection of a typed XML instance.
The relational schema name of the XML schema collection of a typed XML instance.
The name of the XML schema collection of a typed XML instance.
The Name is `null`, or objectName is `null` when database and owningSchema are non-`null`.
A SqlDbType that is not allowed was passed to the constructor as dbType.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData"></xref> class with the specified column name, type, maximum length, locale, and compare options.
Only the following are allowed to be passed to the constructor as `dbType`: `Char`, `NChar`, `Ntext`, `NVarChar`, `Text`, `VarChar`.
Only a `maxLength` specification of <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.Max%2A>, or -1, is allowed for a `dbType` of `Text` or `NText`.

For a `dbType` of `Varchar` or `Nvarchar`, a length specification of <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.Max%2A>, or -1, declares the metadata as varchar(max) and nvarchar(max), respectively.

The following are the default values assigned to `dbType`, depending on the `SqlDbType` (the <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionDatabase%2A>, <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionName%2A>, <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionOwningSchema%2A>, and <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.Type%2A> properties are set to `null`):
SqlDbType
Precision
Scale
The name of the parameter or column.
The SQL Server type of the parameter or column.
The maximum length of the specified type.
The locale ID of the parameter or column.
The comparison rules of the parameter or column.
The Name is `null`.
A SqlDbType that is not allowed was passed to the constructor as dbType.

The name of the column.

A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> instance that points to the UDT.
The SQL Server type name for userDefinedType.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData"></xref> class with the specified column name, type, precision, and scale.
Only the following `SqlDbType` is allowed to be passed to the constructor as `dbType`: `Decimal`.

The following are the default values assigned to `dbType`, depending on the `SqlDbType` (the <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionDatabase%2A>, <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionName%2A>, <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionOwningSchema%2A>, and <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.Type%2A> properties are set to `null`):

Only the following `SqlDbType` is allowed to be passed to the constructor as `dbType`: `UDT`.

The following are the default values assigned to `dbType`, depending on the `SqlDbType` (the <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionDatabase%2A>, <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionName%2A>, <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionOwningSchema%2A>, and <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.Type%2A> properties are set to `null`):

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData"></xref> class with the specified column name, type, and maximum length.
Only the following are allowed to be passed to the constructor as `dbType`: `Binary`, `Char`, `Image`, `NChar`, `Ntext`, `NVarChar`, `Text`, `VarBinary`, `VarChar`.
Only a `maxLength` specification of <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.Max%2A>, or -1 is allowed for a `dbType` of `Text`, `NText`, or `Image`.

For a `dbType` of `Varchar`, `Nvarchar`, or `VarBinary`, a length specification of <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.Max%2A>, or -1, declares the metadata as varchar(max), nvarchar(max), or nvarbinary(max), respectively.

The following are the default values assigned to `dbType`, depending on the `SqlDbType` (the <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionDatabase%2A>, <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionName%2A>, <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionOwningSchema%2A>, and <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.Type%2A> properties are set to `null`):

The name assigned to the returned <xref href="Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData"></xref> instance.
The inferred metadata as a <xref href="Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData"></xref> instance.
The value is `null`.
Indicates if the column in the table-valued parameter is unique.
The default is `FALSE`.
This property can only be set in one of the <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData> constructors.
For more information, see [Table-Valued Parameters](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/table-valued-parameters.md).
A `Boolean` value.
Gets the locale ID of the column or parameter.
The default value is the current locale of the current thread for string-valued SqlDbTypes, and 0 for SqlDbTypes that do not support collation.
Returns 0 if the collation of the underlying column type is not defined.
The locale ID of the column or parameter as a <xref href="System.Int64"></xref>.
Gets the length of `text`, `ntext`, and `image` data types.
The default value is -1.
The length of `text`, `ntext`, and `image` data types.
Gets the maximum length of the column or parameter.
The potential maximum length for values of the specified column.
Returns 0 for types other than fixed and varying length character and binary types.
For variable size columns or parameters declared with the `Max` constructor parameter, it returns -1.
For <xref:System.Data.DbType>.`Row`
this returns the number of columns in the row metadata instance.
The default value is 0.
The maximum length of the column or parameter as a <xref href="System.Int64"></xref>.
Gets the name of the column or parameter.
The name of the column or parameter as a <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
The Name specified in the constructor is longer than 128 characters.
Gets the precision of the column or parameter.
Returns 0 if the precision of the underlying column type is not defined.
The precision of the column or parameter as a <xref href="System.Byte"></xref>.
Gets the scale of the column or parameter.
Returns 0 if the scale of the underlying column type is not defined.
The scale of the column or parameter.
Returns the sort order for a column.
This property can only be set in one of the <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData> constructors.
For more information, see [Table-Valued Parameters](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/table-valued-parameters.md).
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SortOrder"></xref> object.
Returns the ordinal of the sort column.
The default is 1.
This property can only be set in one of the <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData> constructors.
For more information, see [Table-Valued Parameters](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/table-valued-parameters.md).
The ordinal of the sort column.
Gets the data type of the column or parameter.
The default value is `NVarChar`.
The data type of the column or parameter as a <xref href="System.Data.DbType"></xref>.
Gets the common language runtime (CLR) type of a user-defined type (UDT).
The default value is `null`.
Returns `null` if <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.SqlDbType%2A> is not a UDT type.
`Null` may also returned for valid UDT result sets where the assembly is not available to the application.
The CLR type name of a user-defined type as a <xref href="System.Type"></xref>.
Gets the three-part name of the user-defined type (UDT) or the SQL Server type represented by the instance.
The default value is `null`.
The name of the UDT or SQL Server type as a <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
Reports whether this column should use the default server value.
The default is `FALSE`.
This property can only be set in one of the <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData> constructors.
A `Boolean` value.
Gets the name of the database where the schema collection for this XML instance is located.
The default value is `null`.
This property may be `null` if the collection is defined within the current database.

It is also `null` if there is no schema collection, in which case <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionName%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionOwningSchema%2A> are also null.
The name of the database where the schema collection for this XML instance is located as a <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
Gets the name of the schema collection for this XML instance.
The default value is `null`.
This value is `null` if there is no associated schema collection.

If the value is `null`, then <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionDatabase%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionOwningSchema%2A> are also `null`.
The name of the schema collection for this XML instance as a <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
Gets the owning relational schema where the schema collection for this XML instance is located.
The default value is `null`.
This value may be `null` if the collection is defined within the current database and default schema.

It is also null if there is no schema collection, in which case <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionDatabase%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlMetaData.XmlSchemaCollectionName%2A> are also `null`.
The owning relational schema where the schema collection for this XML instance is located as a <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
